problem.text:
Suppose you have a pickaxe like the one shown below. In this problem, we are going to treat it just as a simple T shape. In each figure, an axis of rotation is given. For the purposes of this problem, you may assume the following:
The mass is completely equally distributed
The length of the head is equal to the length of the handle
The width of the head and handle can be ignored
The axis given is either at the end or in the exact center of either the head or the handle

text.h4: Rank the moment of inertia of the pickaxe about the given axis in each figure from greatest to least.
text.p: To rank them: use the letters A-E and the symbols = and >. For example, A = B > C means "A and B have the same moment of inertia about their given axes, and they both have a greater moment of inertia about the given axis than C." If you believe that they cannot all be ranked, select from one of the reasons below and put the corresponding reason number into the bottom row (be sure to leave the top row blank).

Reason 1: More information about the mass is needed.
Reason 2: More information about the lengths is needed.
Reason 3: It is impossible to calculate the moment of inertia of a T shape.

customresponse.answer:
correct_answer = [ {'draggables': ['B'],'targets': ['item1'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['A'],'targets': ['item2'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['D','E'],'targets': ['item3','item4'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['C'],'targets': ['item5'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['gt'],'targets': ['sign1','sign2','sign4'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}, {'draggables': ['eq'],'targets': ['sign3'],'rule':'unordered_equal'}]
if draganddrop.grade(submission[0], correct_answer): correct = ['correct'] else: correct = ['incorrect']
